title: The Value of Large Randomized Trials of Two Active Interventions to Define the Optimal Treatment in Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome

Although clopidogrel, in addition to aspirin, has been the standard of care for many years (1), 2 large randomized trials showed that prasugrel and ticagrelor are superior to clopidogrel in this patient population (2, 3). The dosing algorithm of prasugrel was adjusted after the initial trial because of safety concerns, and a dosage reduction to 5 mg/d was recommended for patients aged 75 years and older or those with a body weight less than 60 kg (3).
